meanings.definition: To discount a negotiable instrument a second time, often at a lower rate.
meanings.sent1: After a while, the bank decided to rediscount the loan for the customer.
meanings.sent2: Banks sometimes offer rediscounting services to help businesses manage their finances.
meanings.sent3: The idea of rediscounting the bill made the accountant chuckle.
meanings.sent4: She rediscounted the note with a fresh perspective, seeing its value in a new light.
meanings.sent5: The concept of rediscounting can be a useful tool for financial planning.

meanings.definition: The act of rediscounting a negotiable instrument.
meanings.sent1: The rediscounting of the bond was a common practice in the financial sector.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the process of rediscounting is essential for financial analysts.
meanings.sent3: The sudden announcement of rediscounting caused a stir among investors.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, rediscounting plays a crucial role in liquidity management.
meanings.sent5: Her expertise in rediscounting made her a valuable asset to the bank.
